data.title: Top NetSuite Alternatives Of 2024
data.meta_description: Is Netsuite not meeting your specific needs? Check out our list of top Netsuite alternatives to find the right system for you.
data.text:
Written By

Contributor

Reviewed

|Deputy Editor, SMB

& 1 other

Editorial Note: We earn a commission from partner links on Forbes Advisor. Commissions do not affect our editors' opinions or evaluations.

NetSuite is an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system that offers a suite of powerful features with many customization options. However, while it’s a popular ERP option, it can be pricey and intimidating for newcomers. To help you choose the best ERP system for your business, we’ve put together a list of the top NetSuite alternatives. We ranked each based on pricing, features and general ease of use to find the best competitors and determine which one is right for you.

Read more

The Best NetSuite Alternatives of 2024

Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central: Best Overall NetSuite Alternative

Odoo: Best for Open Source Business Apps

SAP Business One Professional: Best for Real-Time Data Insights

SYSPRO: Best for Manufacturing and Distribution

QT9: Best for the Medical Industry

Epicor Prophet 21 ERP: Best for Wholesale Distributors

Acumatica: Best for Growing Businesses

Best Overall NetSuite Alternative

Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central

5.0

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Starting price

$70 per user

per month

Free trial

30-day free trial

Key features

On-premises and cloud solutions, project management, mobile app

Learn More

Read Forbes' Review

$70 per user

per month

30-day free trial

On-premises and cloud solutions, project management, mobile app

Editor's Take

Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central is ranked as one of our top ERP systems and offers a great NetSuite alternative for small or medium-sized businesses. Starting at $70 monthly per user, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central is less expensive than NetSuite and offers a range of powerful features that connect your sales, service, finance and operations together.

Use it to manage your supply chain and warehouse with features for inventory, sales, purchasing, fulfillment and delivery. You can even leverage it for project management, something that NetSuite doesn’t offer. Upgrade to its premium tier at $100 per user, per month and receive service management and manufacturing capabilities.

Learn more: Read our full Microsoft Dynamics 365 review.

Who should use it:

If you’re looking for a low-cost and robust alternative to NetSuite, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central is a great option. Plus, it integrates with other Microsoft tools, including Sales Professional, Power BI and Power Apps, making it great if you already use Microsoft products.

Pros & Cons

Well-priced ERP option with advanced features

Integrates with other Microsoft 365 products

On-the-go mobile app

Reports can be hard to read and understand

Additional Microsoft 365 products cost extra

Users find it can be slow at times

Best for Open Source Business Apps

Odoo

4.8

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Starting price

Free; $24.90 per user, per month

(if billed annually)

Free trial

15 days for paid plans

Key features

Dropshipping, e-commerce platform, open source

Learn More

Read Forbes' Review

Free; $24.90 per user, per month

(if billed annually)

15 days for paid plans

Dropshipping, e-commerce platform, open source

Editor's Take

Odoo is an open source ERP and CRM platform offering a suite of business apps to manage your sales, finance, human resources, marketing, services, productivity, inventory and websites. Its free tier lets you choose one app from its marketplace to try out. Upgrade to its paid tiers starting at $24.90 per user, per month (if billed annually) to access all of its apps. Upgrade further to take advantage of its on-premises or multi-company solutions at $37.40 per user, per month (if billed annually).

Unlike some ERP systems, Odoo offers features for dropshipping and e-commerce. NetSuite offers both, but its e-commerce suite costs extra. Plus, Odoo is one of the few options that has a free tier, something that NetSuite doesn’t offer.

Learn more: Read our full Odoo review.

Who should use it:

Those looking for an open source ERP system with a range of customizable business apps should consider Odoo. It’s also a great option if you’re price sensitive or want to try out the product before you buy.

Pros & Cons

Open source ERP and CRM

Vast marketplace of business apps

Robust e-commerce platform

Free plan is limited

Customizations can be challenging

Annual plan discount only valid for 12 months

Best for Real-Time Data Insights

SAP Business One Professional

4.5

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Starting price

Contact for quote

Free trial

No

Key features

Real-time data insights, industry-specific capabilities, quick deployment

Learn More

Read Forbes' Review

Contact for quote

No

Real-time data insights, industry-specific capabilities, quick deployment

Editor's Take

SAP Business One Professional is a leading NetSuite alternative geared toward managing your entire small business. It offers features for financial management, sales and customer management, purchasing and inventory control, business intelligence as well as industry-specific capabilities. Unlike NetSuite, it offers both cloud and on-premises solutions.

However, while it offers all the features a small business needs to scale, it doesn’t offer transparent pricing and can be complex to use. Still, it’s a great NetSuite alternative for small businesses needing real-time data, especially those in retail, wholesale distribution, professional services or consumer products.

Learn more: Read our full SAP Business One Professional review.

Who should use it:

SAP Business One Professional is a great option for small businesses needing to manage daily operations with real-time updates. It’s also a good option for some industry-specific businesses due to its industry features.

Pros & Cons

Easily locate customer information in real time

Generate template or custom reports

Centralized hub for streamlined operations

Interface can feel old or dated

Can be pricier than other options

Customer support could be improved

Best for Manufacturing and Distribution

SYSPRO

4.5

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Starting price

$199 per user

per month

Free trial

No

Key features

Supply chain management, inventory management, finance and accounting

Learn More

On SYSPRO's Website

$199 per user

per month

No

Supply chain management, inventory management, finance and accounting

Editor's Take

SYSPRO is a great NetSuite alternative thanks to its ease of use and transparent pricing. While it may be pricier than some options with a starting monthly price of $199 per user, it’s still less expensive than NetSuite. SYSPRO excels in inventory, warehouse and supply chain management. This is specifically useful to manufacturing or distribution companies, such as automotive, fabricated metals, food and beverage, medical devices and more.

SYSPRO also offers robust financial and accounting features as well as advanced reporting. However, it doesn’t offer HR features, and its CRM functionality costs extra. NetSuite, on the other hand, has a native CRM and offers HR features as an add-on.

Learn more: Read our full SYSPRO review.

Who should use it:

SYSPRO is great for manufacturing and distribution companies that need to manage large-volume orders, procure raw or finished materials as well as optimize inventory.

Pros & Cons

Great for manufacturing or distribution companies

Easy to use platform

Advanced supply chain management features

No HR features

CRM features cost extra

Can be pricier than some with no free trial

Best for the Medical Industry

QT9

4.3

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Starting price

Contact for quote

Free trial

30-day free trial

Key features

Manual task automation, centralized data, multilocation inventory management

Learn More

On QT9's Website

Contact for quote

30-day free trial

Manual task automation, centralized data, multilocation inventory management

Editor's Take

QT9 is a NetSuite alternative offering both cloud and on-premises solutions. It’s an all-in-one solution that supports the management and automation of business data across multiple systems. QT9 is designed for medical companies, such as life science businesses, biotech organizations and pharmaceutical companies, thanks to its ability to keep sensitive information compliant.

Standout features include inventory management, bill of materials (BOM), manufacturing and production tracking, sales management and more. However, it doesn’t offer native accounting features but rather integrates with QuickBooks or Sage 50.

Learn more: Read our full QT9 review.

Who should use it:

QT9 is great for companies in the medical industry that want to streamline operations and data management.

Pros & Cons

Multilocation inventory management capabilities

Real-time production data

Sales order tracking

Doesn’t offer native accounting features

Custom reports can be difficult to create

Doesn’t include HR features

Best for Wholesale Distributors

Epicor Prophet 21 ERP

4.2

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Starting price

Contact for quote

Free trial

No

Key features

Value-added service management, highly customizable, robust reporting

Learn More

Read Forbes' Review

Contact for quote

No

Value-added service management, highly customizable, robust reporting

Editor's Take

Epicor Prophet 21 ERP is a good NetSuite alternative offering wholesale distributors features to help manage their value-added services, supply chain, finance and accounting, customer experience, business intelligence and more. It even offers e-commerce solutions as well as mobile proof of delivery for your drivers. NetSuite only offers mobile proof of delivery through its third-party app marketplace and only offers e-commerce features as a paid add-on.

Epicor is highly customizable with dynamic portals that provide employees with real-time data that’s relevant to them. It offers customizable forms as well as a report studio for robust reporting dashboards.

Learn more: Read our full Epicor Prophet 21 review.

Who should use it:

Epicor Prophet 21 is good for distributors, such as wholesalers, who provide value-added services and need a highly customizable solution with robust reporting.

Pros & Cons

Customizable portals, reports and dashboards

Value-added service management

Robust customer support portal

Can be difficult to use at first

Data aggregation can be slow

No on-premises solution

Best for Growing Businesses

Acumatica

4.2

Our ratings take into account a product's cost, features, ease of use, customer service and other category-specific attributes. All ratings are determined solely by our editorial team.

Starting price

Contact for quote

Free trial

No

Key features

Role-based permissions, scalable architecture, rapid API integrations

Learn More

Read Forbes' Review

Contact for quote

No

Role-based permissions, scalable architecture, rapid API integrations

Editor's Take

Acumatica is a cloud-based NetSuite alternative service for small and midsized businesses. It’s known for its scalable architecture with cloud solutions that offer flexibility for growing businesses. It offers financial management, inventory management and e-commerce integrations with leading providers, including Shopify and Amazon. It also offers role-based permissions so your team can see role-specific views and dashboards.

In addition to its modular architecture, it also has robust APIs for rapid third-party integrations, helping your business scale more quickly. It even includes real-time reporting for your remote or in-field team, helping everyone stay updated on key business metrics. However, it doesn’t offer public pricing and could be costly for some.

Learn more: Read our full Acumatica review.

Who should use it:

Acumatica is best for growing businesses that need to scale quickly thanks to its flexible architecture and robust API integrations.

Pros & Cons

Robust third-party integration capabilities

Scalable cloud architecture

Real-time reporting insights

Doesn’t offer on-premises solutions

Interface can be difficult to use

Missing some native ERP features

Methodology

When determining the top NetSuite alternatives, Forbes Advisor considered 18 ERP providers, analyzing each across five weighted scoring categories with a total of 25 individual scoring metrics. Providers were ranked based on their total score across the five categories to determine the best NetSuite alternatives.

Here are the specific scoring categories we used:

Pricing – 10%

NetSuite doesn’t offer public pricing or a free trial, though it does offer a free demo. It’s typically a pricier option suited for larger companies. When assessing the top alternatives, we took into account affordability and the availability of trials as well as price transparency. While it’s not common for ERPs to offer public pricing and free trials, it’s possible to find alternatives that are more affordable with available pricing and free trials.

General Features – 30%

Top NetSuite competitors should offer all the core features you’d expect out of a leading ERP system. When scoring the top alternatives, we assessed key functionalities such as warehouse management, inventory management, cloud accounting, CRM features, robust reporting, third-party integrations and the ability to receive real-time updates.

We also assessed whether each ERP offered a cloud-based or on-premises solution. NetSuite scored close to 100% in this category but doesn’t offer an on-premises solution. There are alternatives available that offer both cloud-based or on-premises ERP options.

Advanced Features – 20%

In addition to core features, the best NetSuite alternatives should also offer advanced features, including robust automations, HR functionality, financial management and supply chain management. NetSuite scored high marks in this category. However, some key features, such as its advanced automations and HR management system, need to be purchased as add-ons.

Third-Party Ratings and Reviews – 10%

Important to our scoring criteria is real-world feedback from users. To assess what users think about the top NetSuite alternatives, we looked at third-party reviews and ratings. We considered both the average rating across leading rating sites as well as the total number of reviews. This ensures that user ratings are statistically significant.

Expert Score – 30%

We also took into account our own firsthand experience with the top NetSuite alternatives. When scoring options using our expert score, we assessed metrics such as ease of use, customer support quality and value for the money. Overall, we found NetSuite to be highly customizable but more complex and more costly than some alternative options.

Compare NetSuite Competitors

What To Look For in a NetSuite Alternative

There are many factors to consider when choosing a NetSuite alternative. The first is pricing. NetSuite doesn’t offer a free trial and is one of the pricier options available. When assessing NetSuite competitors, consider your overall budget and find a solution that delivers the most value for the money. Also consider any third-party costs if you integrate with other software.

The next thing you want to consider are the core features offered in the top NetSuite alternatives. All leading ERP systems should include features such as accounting, warehouse management, inventory management, CRM functionality and more, as well as offer both on-premises or cloud solutions. NetSuite doesn’t offer on-premises ERP options, but some competitors do.

You also want to consider advanced features when selecting a NetSuite alternative. NetSuite’s ERP offers many advanced functionalities, such as robust automations and financial management. However, some advanced functionalities, such as its HR and manufacturing features require add-on upgrades, increasing the price. Choose an alternative option that has all the advanced features you need for a fair price.

Finally, consider overall ease of use and customer support. NetSuite is a popular, highly customizable option with a lot of flexibility. But, it can be overwhelming and difficult to use at times. There may be other options that are more user-friendly. Make sure you assess NetSuite competitors across the full range of pricing, features and overall ease of use.

Is NetSuite the Best ERP System?

NetSuite offers a full suite of general and advanced features with add-on upgrades and third-party apps to customize the experience. It’s a powerful option for many businesses. However, it doesn’t offer an on-premises solution and its add-on features can make it pricey. However, it doesn’t offer an on-premises solution and its add-on features can make it pricey. Plus, it doesn’t offer a free trial and may be harder to use than alternative options for users who are less tech savvy

Let’s take a look at the pros, cons and cost of NetSuite, including when to choose a competitor:

NetSuite Pros and Cons

All ERP systems have benefits and drawbacks, and NetSuite is no different. When assessing the top alternatives, make sure you fully understand what NetSuite does well and where it can be improved. This will help you make the best decision for your business.

NetSuite is a powerful ERP system that offers robust features, including financial management, inventory management, cloud accounting, CRM functionality and reporting. You can customize your experience by adding features, such as payroll, HR, demand planning, manufacturing, fixed assets management and contract renewals. NetSuite also offers SuiteApps, a third-party app marketplace for NetSuite.

On the downside, NetSuite has a high starting price and can become even more costly if you pay for add-on features and functionalities. While it’s versatile, it can be overwhelming for some and, despite generous training and onboarding tools, more intimidating to use when compared to alternative options. NetSuite is best for larger companies that need a wide range of features and customization.

NetSuite Cost

NetSuite doesn’t offer publicly available pricing and doesn’t have a free trial offer, but it does offer a free demo. While this isn’t uncommon for the industry, there are NetSuite alternatives that are more affordable and offer free trials. For example, while you can purchase NetSuite’s human resource management system (HRIS) as a paid add-on, it doesn’t come with its core ERP system.

When purchasing NetSuite, you first need to choose a base package. From there, you can select the number of user licenses as well as any add-on modules. Schedule a call to get a specific quote.

When To Choose a Competitor Over NetSuite

NetSuite offers a leading ERP system with a suite of general and advanced features. However, some functionalities cost extra, making it potentially pricey versus other alternatives. Choose a NetSuite competitor if you’re looking for a better-priced ERP solution with transparent fees and on-premises capabilities.

Read our NetSuite review for a full rundown of its features, pricing and primary use cases.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

What's better than NetSuite?

NetSuite is a leading ERP provider, but there are alternatives that might better suit your needs. Leading NetSuite competitors include Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, Odoo, SAP Business One Professional and SYSPRO. Each of these alternatives provides a unique set of benefits and features that may be right for your business.

Is there a free NetSuite alternative?

Unfortunately, there are no free NetSuite alternatives. However, some NetSuite competitors offer free trials as well as money-back guarantees while NetSuite does not. If you’re looking to test an ERP system before you buy it, go with an option that includes a free trial.

Is NetSuite better than SAP?

SAP and NetSuite are comparable ERP solutions. Both offer a wealth of features and are easy to use. However, SAP offers on-premises solutions and CRM features, two things that NetSuite doesn’t offer. However, NetSuite offers supply chain management while SAP does not.

Is NetSuite still relevant?

NetSuite is still a leading ERP system geared toward medium or large businesses that need a powerful solution with a lot of customization options and scalability. However, it can be pricey if you need to pay for add-on features, and some find it difficult to use. There are alternatives, such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, that might be a better fit.
